result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert G Schackow was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Robert G Schackow is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Robert G Schackow was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert G Schackow

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Marquette County DNA Proof of Submission

Defendant Robert G Schackow in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee moves to amend Ct. 1 to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1).    Atty Hendee states plea agreement to the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.  Atty Goldin agrees.  Defendant agrees
BY THE COURT:  Ct. 1 amended to Disorderly Conduct 947.01(1)

Defendant enters a No Contest plea.
  Court questions defendant regarding plea. Advises of Constitutional Rights and elements of the charge.  Court finds plea made knowingly, voluntarily & Intelligently.  Court relies on the criminal complaint for a factual basis.  

BY THE COURT:  Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.  Court accepts defendant's plea and finds defendant guilty of the amended Ct. 1.  Ct. 2 to be dismissed.

BY THE COURT:  Amended Ct. 1:  Pay fine and costs = $379.00
DNA Sample + $200.00 Surcharge
60 days to pay

Ct. 2 to be dismissed.
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 22, 2016 at 10:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Final pre-trial on November 4, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial on December 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on June 15, 2016 at 02:10 pm.

Final pre-trial at 05-06-2016 08:30 am.
Jury trial at 06-30-2016 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert G Schackow in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Goldin states there is not a resolution today.  Requests trial be set.
BY THE COURT:  Set for trial.  Jury trial scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert G Schackow in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty Hendee states that Atty Goldin was just put on the case and parties need more time to discuss.
Atty Golding agrees.

BY THE COURT:  Reset
bond continued.,
  Return date scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Robert G Schackow in court.  Chad A. Hendee appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Atty Hendee states that bond needs to be set along with booking.
  Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint & waives it's reading.  Court advises defendant of right to an attorney.  Defendant understands.
Court finds probable cause.
  Atty Hendee has no objection to a signature bond with conditions.

  BY THE COURT:  Court sets a $500 Signature bond with conditions:
*Appear for booking today

  BY THE COURT:  Court enters a Not Guilty plea on behalf of the defendant.

Court questions the defendant.  Defendant wants to talk to his Attorney, Attorney Young.
BY THE COURT:  Set for Return.  Return date scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 02:30 pm.


BACK ON THE RECORD:
Defendant needs to pick up his kids so he is asking to come back to appear for booking.

BY THE COURT:  Court will give the defendant until Wednesday.
Defendant states that he will come back after 5:30pm tonight.
